pullRequest.title: Clarify that a BOM shall only be for your own project's modules
pullRequest.bodyText: I've seen far too many bad BOMs. Please ensure that people undertsand the BOM is only for the stuff you ship and not for the dependencies of the stuff you ship

commit.message: Clarify that a BOM shall only be for your own project's modules

nodes.bodyText: We haven't been using standards language like SHALL and MUST here. I think this sentence already says this, but we can clarify as you suggest below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -23,10 +23,14 @@ in their own `<dependencyManagement>` section and omit the
 versions from the specific modules they import. The versions will
 be set by the BOM. This provides consistent versions for artifacts released
 by a single project.
-Your project's BOM should include every non-test-scoped module in the project.
+Your project's BOM shall include only those non-test-scoped modules in *your* project.

@@ -23,10 +23,14 @@ in their own `<dependencyManagement>` section and omit the
 versions from the specific modules they import. The versions will
 be set by the BOM. This provides consistent versions for artifacts released
 by a single project.
-Your project's BOM should include every non-test-scoped module in the project.
+Your project's BOM shall include only those non-test-scoped modules in *your* project.
 Otherwise, a consumer who depends on an unspecified module must specify and
 upgrade the version of that module, defeating the purpose of the BOM.
 
+Your project's BOM shall not include any of your dependencies on other libraries.

nodes.bodyText: How about "Specifying versions of libraries from other projects can lead to BOM dependency conflicts that are exceedingly tricky to resolve"?
